channel.title: Confused about laptop performances
channel.description:
hey i recently got this
[url]https://www.engadget.com/2009/03/10/msi-announces-the-vx600-15-4-inch-notebook/[/url] [the 3 gb ram edition]
and i am really confused about it's performance, some people have been telling me i'm supposed to run prototype in high , crysys in med-high n shit , but i finished prototype in low settings , crysys in very low settings , and even COD4 moves laggy , i got ultimate vista x86 [ like x32 or something ] on it , does it run slower then it should? , the games i install autoset themselves in very high settings , but they run very laggy if i don't tweak it , also , asssasins creed works laggy in med settings with alot of things disabled , hl2ep2 works 30-20 fps with everything on high [fallout 3 was laggy too , sometimes , in some settings , but the settiings didn't matter much , devil may cry 4 works in 50-60 fps only in very low settings , stalker works good in mid-low , crimes of war in low-med combination ] does it work slower then it should?
also , is ATI3410 HD a good card? [512]

item.title: Confused about laptop performances

item.title: Confused about laptop performances
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Anyway to clarify it’s most certainly the graphics card, the pentium dual core is a core 2 duo with less l2 cache so there’s no performance loss in games, but that graphics card pretty much sucks, you should have got a laptop with a HD4xxx series card or a nvidia 8xxx

Read full topic

so assasins creed is a bad example , bioshock only runs smooth in low settings, it runs worst then crysys in low settings , it’s wierd !

item.title: Confused about laptop performances
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
Assassins creed it a pretty intense game, your processor probably has quite a lot to do with it, but it’s also a poorly optimized game. I was trying to run it on my old 8600 (in a laptop actually), and it went on low-mid settings, and that was when the card and the game were fairly new.

Read full topic

item.title: Confused about laptop performances
item.dc:creator: iKy
item.description:
that’s kind of how it runs on mine , with no AA and biliniar and color corretion off [vsync on] , ir runs about the same ,50-60 fps in closed areas ,… so i no need to worry that my laptop doesn’t run 100% , hell it’s kind of weak this way…

Read full topic

item.title: Confused about laptop performances
item.dc:creator: Siggs
item.description:
Well my laptop runs Episode 2 at medium to high, no AA, at the same frame rate, 20-30. In closed areas, it can jump to 40.
I can’t say I’ve tried any of the other mentioned games tho. It’s a fairly similar graphics card, cpu and ram.

my specs
.

Read full topic

item.title: Confused about laptop performances
item.dc:creator: iKy
item.description:
well i only want to find out if the laptop is working fine or it works under it’s potential , so the reason i couldn’t play assasin’s creed in med-high , med is cause of the processor?

The Wandering God

Read full topic

item.title: Confused about laptop performances
item.dc:creator: Siggs
item.description:
you could always try a program called mobility modder, it lets you use the desktop ATI drivers on laptop cards. I was skeptical at first, but there don’t seem to be any detrimental effects, gives a few extra frames in some situations.

But that’s only a small thing, can’t boost your performance as much as you want.
.

Read full topic

item.title: Confused about laptop performances
item.dc:creator: Duck
item.description:
Repzik:

You have a Pentium Dual Core, which I believe is different than a Core Two Duo.

You messed up. You should have clarified to make sure that was the kind of dual core you wanted.

Like this?


If that’s the same, Mine plays the games iky mentioned that has problems, on high.
